alert.note: Alert for Boone; Campbell; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 8:53PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF KENTON... CAMPBELL...SOUTHERN BOONE...NORTHERN GRANT... PENDLETON AND EASTERN GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 853 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Dry Ridge, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Covington, Florence, Independence, Alexandria, Taylor Mill, Williamstown, Walton, Falmouth, Claryville, Union, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Butler, Cold Spring, Ryland Heights, Mentor, Moscow, Fairview, Stewartsville, and Visalia. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 68 and 77. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 154 and 177. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH

area.areaDesc: Boone; Campbell; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Pendleton
